japanese: 春なのにサンタが飾ってある……。
translation:
Even though it's spring,
there are Santa decorations...

japanese:
赤い靴下に、クリスマスツリーも。
１年中クリスマスグッズを売っているお店が
あるというのは、本当だったんですね。
translation:
Red stockings and a Christmas tree too.
It's true that there are stores
selling Christmas goods all year round.

japanese:
ここだけ年中１２月なのか。
寒空でケーキ売ってたのを思い出すぜ。
translation:
It feels like it's December all year round here.
I remember when I sold cakes
in the cold weather.

japanese:
ええ、ありましたね。
私たちのアパートまで配達に来てくださって、
ご苦労様でした。
translation:
Yes, I remember that.
You even delivered one to our apartment.
I appreciated your effort.

japanese:
ったく、配達先で川に落ちるなんてな。
全員、風邪も引かずにすんで良かったが。
translation:
Ugh, but to fall into the river on the way to the 
delivery destination. Thank goodness everyone came 
out of it without catching a cold.

japanese:
あの時は、あなたが溺れてしまったら、
なんて考える前に、とっさに体が動いていたんです。
translation:
At that time, before I even had time to think
about what would happen if you drowned,
my body just moved instinctively.

japanese: みんなも、そうだったんだと思います。
translation: I think everyone felt the same way.

japanese: ……おう。
translation: ...Right.

japanese:
あ、あのクリスマスも散々でしたが、
去年も受験勉強で忙しくて、
それどころじゃありませんでしたね。
translation:
Th-that Christmas wasn't very good either.
Last year, I was too busy studying for exams
to even think about it.

japanese:
でも、勉強会後のパーティーは、
ささやかでしたが楽しかったです。
二乃お手製のケーキも美味しかったですし。
translation:
But the party we had after the study session was 
small but fun.
The cake that Nino made was delicious, too.

japanese: ああ、いい息抜きになった。
translation: Yeah, it was a nice break.

japanese:
……いまだから言いますが、
あの時、上杉君がプレゼントをくれたのは
少し意外でした。
translation:
...I'll say it now, but I was a little surprised
when you gave me a present back then, Uesugi-kun.

japanese:
なっ！　意外ってなんだよ！
俺だってそれくらいはするぞ！
translation:
Wha-what do you mean by surprised?!
It was the least I could do!

japanese:
ま、まあ、なんだ。
散々悩んだ挙げ句、捻りもないクリスマスカードに
したのは、我ながらどうなのかと思ってるが。
translation:
W-well, anyhow.
Even though I worried so much, in the end,
I just gave you a plain ol' Christmas card.

japanese:
嬉しかったですよ？
心が籠もっているのはしっかり感じましたから。
translation:
But I was happy, you know?
I could feel your sincerity.

japanese: ならよかった。
translation: That's great, then.

japanese:
上杉君も、私のあげたプレゼントを
ちゃんと使ってくれていましたよね。
translation:
Uesugi-kun, you also used the present
I gave you, right?

japanese:
あれは助かった。
五月のくれたマフラーのおかげで
冬を越せたと言っても過言じゃねぇよ。
translation:
That really helped me out. Thanks to the scarf
you gave me, I was able to get through the winter
without any problems.

japanese: ふふ、お役に立ったようでなによりです。
translation: Teehee, I'm glad I could be of help.

japanese:
あなたは真冬であってもコートも着ませんし、
寒そうで心配していたんですからね？
translation:
I was worried about you,
since you don't even wear a coat,
even in the middle of winter.

japanese:
すまん。
今年のクリスマスプレゼントは俺も
実用的な物にするかな。
translation:
Sorry about that.
I think I'll give you something practical
for this year's Christmas present.

japanese:
あなたからもらえるのなら、なんでも嬉しいですよ？
また手書きのクリスマスカードでも。
translation:
If it's a gift from you, I'd be happy with anything.
Even if it's just a handwritten Christmas card.

japanese:
……私たち、今年のクリスマスは
どんな風に過ごすのでしょうね。
translation: ...I wonder how we'll spend Christmas this year?

japanese:
まだ先の話だな。
想像もできねぇし、
クリスマスにたどり着くまでに色々ありすぎる。
translation:
That's still a long way off. I can't even imagine it,
and there are too many things that could happen
before we get to Christmas.

japanese:
あはは……。
まず、大学の授業についていけるかが心配です。
translation:
Ahaha...
First of all, I'm worried about
keeping up with my classes at university.

japanese:
もしかしたら、今年のクリスマスも
ささやかに済ませることになるかもな。
translation: Maybe this Christmas will just have to be a simple one.

japanese:
ううっ！
そうならないように努力しますので！
translation:
Oooohh!
I'll do my best to make sure that doesn't happen!

japanese:
頼むぜ？
留年なんてもっての外だからな？
translation:
You swear?
Repeating a school year is out of the question, you know?

japanese:
２人で過ごしたいよな。
せっかくのクリスマスなんだし。
translation:
I want to spend it together.
It IS Christmas, after all.

japanese:
そ、そうですね。
上杉君と２人で――
translation:
Y-yes, that's true.
Just the two of us, Uesugi-kun and I%p-2;――

japanese:
い、いえ！
ですが、クリスマスというのは
家族で過ごすのも大切なのでは！？
translation:
B-but!
Isn't it important
to spend Christmas with family, too?

japanese:
むしろ、海外では家族で過ごすのが
普通だったりするようですし！
translation:
In fact, it seems like spending Christmas with family
is more common overseas!

japanese:
まあ、２人にしろお前ら全員とにしろ、
一緒に過ごせればそれでいいぞ、俺は。
translation:
Well, whether it's just the two of us or with everyone else,
as long as we spend it together, that's enough for me.

japanese: ……私もです。
translation: ...Me too.

japanese:
今年は盛大にパーティーをするか！
去年の分も取り返すくらいのを！
translation:
Let's have a big party this year!
So we can make up for last year!

japanese:
いいですね。
らいはちゃんも呼んで、みんなで楽しみましょう。
translation:
That's a great idea.
Let's invite Raiha-chan too and have fun with everyone.

japanese:
大きなケーキを用意したり、チキンを焼いたり。
クリスマスツリーも豪華にしたいですね。
translation:
We'll prepare a big cake and roast a chicken.
I also want to decorate a gorgeous Christmas tree.

japanese:
いっそのこと、この店で
いまのうちに飾り付けでも買っておくか？
translation:
Why don't we buy some decorations from this store now
while we're at it?

japanese:
それは、さすがに気が早いのでは？
荷物になってしまいますし。
translation:
That's a bit too early, don't you think?
It'll become a burden to carry around.

japanese: でも、そう思うのもわかるくらいに私も楽しみです。
translation:
But, I understand how you feel.
I'm looking forward to it too.

japanese:
それと、みんなでパーティーのあとは
２人でプレゼント交換、なんていうのはどうだ？
translation:
Actually, how about we exchange gifts,
just the two of us,
after the party with everyone?

japanese: それは……ますます楽しみになりますね。
translation: That...makes me even more excited.

japanese:
よしっ！
いまからじっくり考えて、
最高のプレゼントを渡してやるよ！
translation:
Alright!
I'll carefully think about it
and give you the best present!

japanese:
そんなことを言ってしまっていいんですか？
ハードルが上がってしまいますよ。
translation:
Is it okay to say something like that?
You're raising the bar pretty high.

japanese: ……期待はほどほどで頼む。
translation: ...Don't get your hopes up too high.

japanese: （五月との、３回目のクリスマスか）
translation: (I suppose this will be my third Christmas with Itsuki.)

japanese:
（これから幾度も季節は巡ってくる。
　だが何回目でも、俺はきっとその日を
　どう過ごすのか楽しみにしてるんだろう）
translation:
(The seasons will come and go.
 But no matter how many do, I'm sure I'll always be
 looking forward to how I'll spend that day with her.)
